intro: Haplopappus filifolius, commonly known as the silky pappus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf structure. The plant features narrow, silvery-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft, fuzzy appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. Haplopappus filifolius is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
